001package org.relationlearn.filters;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
006import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
007import java.net.MalformedURLException;
008import java.net.URL;
009import java.net.URLClassLoader;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.Arrays;
012import java.util.Comparator;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.PriorityQueue;
016import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
017import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser;
018import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory;
019import org.relationlearn.util.RelationClass;
020import org.xml.sax.Attributes;
021import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
022import org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler;
023import weka.core.Attribute;
024import weka.core.FastVector;
025import weka.core.Instance;
026import weka.core.Instances;
027
028/**
029 * Implementation of FilterGroup which applies the TextFilter objects 
030 * to the input in the same order they were added to group and in a 
031 * sequential manner.
032 * 
033 * <p>
034 * <h3>Configuration file options</h3>
035 * Apart adding filters through code you can also supply an XML file
036 * which will contain your desired filter configuration to be used
037 * wihtout adding them manually by code.<br/> The code
038 * below is an example of all the possible input formats:
039 * </p>
040 * <pre>
041 * {@code
042 * <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
043 * <filters>
044 *     <filter id="1" local="yes" relative="no" 
045 *         classpath="file:/C:/your/absolute/path/here">
046 *     class.fully.qualified.name
047 *     </filter>
048 *     <filter id="4" local="yes" relative="yes" 
049 *         classpath="your/relative/path/here">
050 *      class.fully.qualified.name
051 *      <filter_params>
052 *          <param>your_param_value_here</param>
053 *      <filter_params>
054 *     </filter>
055 *     <filter id="3" local="no" classpath="your_url_here">
056 *      class.fully.qualified.name
057 *     </filter>
058 * </filters>
059 * }
060 * </pre>
061 * <p>
062 * You can basically have two types of filter configurations: local filters and
063 * remote filters. Local filters can then be found using a relative path or
064 * an absolute path, both Windows and Linux path separators work directly with 
065 * this system, so only  you need to input the path the same way the 
066 * system represents it.
067 * <p/>
068 * <p>
069 * For remote paths your path is the URL addres where the base directory for
070 * the sources or the .jar file are located.
071 * </p>
072 * <p> 
073 * The id attribute only defines the priority of the filter being
074 * {@link java.lang.Integer#MIN_VALUE} the one with the hightest priority and
075 * {@link java.lang.Integer#MAX_VALUE} the value with less priority. Although
076 * its recommended that you begin identifying your filters with the value 1 
077 * for the first, 2 for the second and so on.
078 * </p>
079 * <p>
080 * Additionally if the TextFilter you want to load accepts additional parameters
081 * , you can supply them inside the {@code filter_params} tag as shown in the
082 * example with {@code id=4}.
083 * </p>
084 * <p>
085 * <b>Important Note:</b> Keep in mind that the only parameters you can 
086 * supply to the TextFilter using a config file will be of type 
087 * {@link java.lang.String} so build your TextFilter with that in mind. 
088 * For example you could provide a constructor that accepts a 
089 * {@link java.util.List} and the implement another
090 * one which accepts as paramter the path to that same list serialized in a 
091 * file for its use with this configuration file.
092 * </p>
093 * 
094 * @see java.net.URLClassLoader
095 * @see FilterGroup
096 * @see TextFilter
097 */
098public class SequentialFilterGroup implements FilterGroup {
099    
100    private static class FilterItem {
101        
102        public final TextFilter FILTER;
103        public final Integer ID;
104        
105        private FilterItem() {
106            this(null, -1);
107        }
108        
109        public FilterItem(TextFilter filter, Integer id) {
110            this.FILTER = filter;
111            this.ID = id;
112        }
113    }
114    
115    private static class ItemComparator implements Comparator<FilterItem> {
116
117        @Override
118        public int compare(FilterItem item1, FilterItem item2) {
119            return item1.ID.compareTo(item2.ID);
120        }
121        
122    }
123    
124    private class SAXParserHelper extends DefaultHandler {
125        
126        private final String FILTER_TAG = "filter";
127        private final String FLTPR_TAG = "filter_params";
128        private final String PARAM_TAG = "param";
129        
130        private final String ID_ATTR = "id";
131        private final String TYPE_ATTR = "type";
132        private final String NAME_ATTR = "name";
133        private final String LOCAL_ATTR = "local";
134        private final String RELATIVE_ATTR = "relative";
135        private final String CLASSPATH_ATTR = "classpath";
136        
137        private final String VALUE_NO = "no";
138        private final String VALUE_YES = "yes";
139        
140        private final PriorityQueue<FilterItem> ITEM_QUEUE;
141        private final List<TextFilter> PARSED_FILTERS;
142        
143        private int filterOrder;
144        private String classPath;
145        
146        private String currentClass;
147        private String currentValue;
148        
149        private final List<String> filterParams;
150        
151        public SAXParserHelper() {
152            this.ITEM_QUEUE = new PriorityQueue<>(11, new ItemComparator());
153            this.PARSED_FILTERS = new LinkedList<>();
154            this.filterParams = new ArrayList<>();
155        }
156        
157        @Override
158        public void startElement(String uri, String localName, String qName, 
159                Attributes attributes) throws SAXException {
160            
161            switch (qName) {
162                case FILTER_TAG:
163                    parseFilterAttributes(attributes);
164                    break;
165                case FLTPR_TAG:
166                    currentClass = currentValue;
167                    filterParams.clear();
168                    break;
169                default:
170                    break;
171            }
172        }
173        
174        @Override
175        public void characters(char[] ac, int i, int j) {
176            currentValue = new String(ac, i, j).trim();
177        }
178        
179        @Override
180        public void endElement(String uri, String localName, String qName) 
181                throws SAXException {
182            switch (qName) {
183                case FILTER_TAG:
184                    TextFilter filter = tryLoadFilter(classPath, filterParams);
185                    FilterItem item = new FilterItem(filter, filterOrder);
186                    ITEM_QUEUE.add(item);
187                    break;
188                case PARAM_TAG:
189                    filterParams.add(currentValue);
190                    break;
191                default:
192                    break;
193            }
194        }
195        
196        public List<TextFilter> getParsingResults() {
197            if(ITEM_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
198                while(ITEM_QUEUE.size() > 0) {
199                    PARSED_FILTERS.add(ITEM_QUEUE.poll().FILTER);
200                }
201            }
202            return this.PARSED_FILTERS;
203        }
204        
205        private void parseFilterAttributes(Attributes attr) 
206                throws SAXException {
207            String id, name, local, relative, classpath;
208            id = attr.getValue(ID_ATTR);
209            name = attr.getValue(NAME_ATTR);
210            local = attr.getValue(LOCAL_ATTR);
211            relative = attr.getValue(RELATIVE_ATTR);
212            classpath = attr.getValue(CLASSPATH_ATTR);
213            if((id != null) && (local != null) && (classpath != null)) {
214                filterOrder = Integer.valueOf(id);
215                switch(local) {
216                    case VALUE_YES:
217                        if(null != relative) {
218                            switch (relative) {
219                                case VALUE_YES:
220                                    classPath = convertRelativePath(classpath);
221                                    break;
222                                case VALUE_NO:
223                                    classPath = classpath;
224                                    break;
225                                default:
226                                    throw new SAXException("Error: relative "
227                                        + "attribute must be set when local "
228                                        + "attribute value is set to {yes} !");
229                            }
230                        } else {
231                            throw new SAXException("Error: relative attribute "
232                                    + "value must be {yes} or {no} !"); 
233                        }
234                        break;
235                    case VALUE_NO:
236                        classPath = classpath;
237                        break;
238                    default:
239                        throw new SAXException("Error: local attribute values "
240                                + "must be {yes} or {no}");
241                }
242            } else {
243                throw new SAXException("Error: filter tag is missing "
244                        + "one or more mandatory attributes!");
245            }
246        }
247        
248        private String convertRelativePath(String relPath) throws SAXException {
249            String absPath;
250            File f = new File(relPath);
251            absPath = f.toURI().normalize().toString();
252            return absPath;
253        }
254        
255        private TextFilter tryLoadFilter(String path, List<String> params) 
256                throws SAXException {
257            TextFilter tf = null;
258            Class[] paramTypes;
259            String[] paramValues;
260            try {
261                URL[] urls = { new URL(path) };
262                URLClassLoader ucl = new URLClassLoader(urls);
263                Class<TextFilter> c;
264                c = (Class<TextFilter>) ucl.loadClass(currentClass)
265                        .asSubclass(TextFilter.class);
266                Constructor<TextFilter> con;
267                if(params.size() > 0) {
268                    paramTypes = new Class[params.size()];
269                    Arrays.fill(paramTypes, String.class);
270                    paramValues = new String[params.size()];
271                    paramValues = params.toArray(paramValues);
272                    con = c.getConstructor(paramTypes);
273                    tf = con.newInstance((Object[]) paramValues); 
274                } else {
275                    con = c.getConstructor();
276                    tf = con.newInstance();
277                }
278                ucl.close();
279            } catch (MalformedURLException muex) {
280                throw new SAXException("Error: path doesn't correspond to a "
281                        + "valid system path/URL");
282            } catch (ClassNotFoundException | NoSuchMethodException | 
283                    SecurityException | InstantiationException | 
284                    IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | 
285                    InvocationTargetException | IOException ex) {
286                throw new SAXException(ex);
287            }
288            return tf;
289        }
290    }
291    
292    private final String GROUP_DATASET;
293    private final FastVector FILTER_ATTRS;
294    private final List<TextFilter> FILTERS;
295    
296    private Attribute classAttr;
297    
298    private Instances filterDataset;
299    
300    private boolean changedFilter;
301    
302    /** 
303     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the 
304     * dataset name "test-dataset" without any filter
305     * added.
306     */
307    public SequentialFilterGroup() {
308        this("test-dataset");
309    }
310    
311    /**
312     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name
313     * {@code dataset} without any filter added.
314     * 
315     * @param dataset the name of this SequentialFilterGroup dataset
316     */
317    public SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset) {
318        this.GROUP_DATASET = dataset;
319        this.FILTER_ATTRS = new FastVector();
320        this.FILTERS = new ArrayList<>();
321        this.filterDataset = new Instances(dataset, FILTER_ATTRS, 0);
322        this.changedFilter = true;
323    }
324    
325    /**
326     * Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name
327     * {@code dataset}, and, using the information found in
328     * {@code configFile}, loads all specified TextFilter objects and
329     * adds them to this SequentialFilterGroup.
330     * 
331     * @param dataset the name of this SequentialFilterGroup dataset
332     * @param configFile the XML file whioh contains the filter configuration
333     * to load onto this SequentialFilterGroup
334     */
335    public SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset, File configFile) {
336        this(dataset);
337        loadFiltersFromFile(configFile);
338    }
339    
340    @Override
341    public String getGroupDatasetName() {
342        return GROUP_DATASET;
343    }
344    
345    @Override
346    public Instances getGroupDataset() {
347        buildInstances();
348        return new Instances(filterDataset); 
349    }
350
351    @Override
352    public FastVector getGroupAttributes() {
353        return FILTER_ATTRS;
354    }
355
356    @Override
357    public Instance createInstanceUsingFilters(String r, String h) {
358        buildInstances();
359        Instance instance = new Instance(filterDataset.numAttributes());
360        for(TextFilter filter : FILTERS) {
361            instance.setValue(filter.getMappedAttribute(), 
362                    filter.filter(r, h));
363        }
364        instance.setDataset(filterDataset);
365        return instance;
366    }
367
368    @Override
369    public void addFilter(TextFilter filter) {
370        changedFilter = true;
371        FILTER_ATTRS.addElement(filter.getMappedAttribute());
372        FILTERS.add(filter);
373    }
374    
375    /**
376     * Adds the Attribute {@code attr} as the Instances class attribute
377     * or sets the Instances class value to 
378     * {@link org.relationlearn.util.RelationClass#DEFAULT_CLASS}.
379     * 
380     * @param attr the Attribute to be used as class attribute or null
381     */
382    @Override
383    public void addClassAttribute(Attribute attr) {
384        if(attr == null) {
385            this.classAttr = RelationClass.DEFAULT_CLASS;
386        } else {
387            this.classAttr = attr;
388        }
389    }
390    
391    private void buildInstances() {
392        if(changedFilter) {
393            FastVector completeAttr = new FastVector(FILTER_ATTRS.size() + 1);
394            completeAttr.appendElements(FILTER_ATTRS);
395            completeAttr.addElement(classAttr);
396            filterDataset = new Instances(GROUP_DATASET, completeAttr, 0);
397            filterDataset.setClassIndex(completeAttr.size() - 1);
398            changedFilter = false;
399        }
400    }
401    
402    private void loadFiltersFromFile(File configFile) {
403        SAXParserFactory factory = SAXParserFactory.newInstance();
404        SAXParserHelper helper = new SAXParserHelper();
405        try {
406            SAXParser parser = factory.newSAXParser();
407            parser.parse(configFile, helper);
408        } catch (ParserConfigurationException | SAXException | 
409                IOException mex) {
410            throw new IllegalArgumentException(mex);
411        }
412        
413        for(TextFilter filter : helper.getParsingResults()) {
414            this.addFilter(filter);
415        }
416    }
417
418}
